app.cards

Class Card

  • java.lang.Object
    • app.cards.Card

  • public class Card
extends java.lang.Object
    A Card object represents a unique card from a deck. Card objects are created with the static initializer getCard(Suit, Rank). There is no public constructor. Whenever Card objects with the same rank and suit are requested via getCard(Suit, Rank), it is guaranteed that the same object is returned.

    • Method Detail

      • getCard

        public static Card getCard(Suit suit,
           Rank rank)
        Get a Card instance with the specified suit and rank. Subsequent calls with the same suit and rank are guaranteed to get the same object.
        Parameters:
        suit - Suit of the card
        rank - Rank of the card
        Returns:
        Card instance with suit and rank

      • randomCard

        public static Card randomCard()
        Returns a random card from the deck. Subsequent calls will keep getting different cards until all of the deck is exhausted. If you call this method after every card has been returned once, an AllCardsDealtException will be thrown. Call resetDeck() to put all cards back in the deck and "reshuffle".
        Returns:
        Card instance with random suit and rank
        Throws:
        AllCardsDealtException - if this method is called after all cards have been dealt

      • fromShortcut

        public static Card fromShortcut(java.lang.String shortcut)
        Creates a Card object from a shortcut like "As" (Ace of Spades) or "8c" (Eight of Clubs).
        Parameters:
        shortcut - two-character shortcut. The first character identifies the rank (as used by Rank.fromShortcut(char)), the second character identifies the suit (as used by Suit.fromShortcut(char))
        Returns:
        Card object identified by the shortcut. Subsequent calls with the same shortcut are guaranteed to get the same Card object.
        See Also:
        Rank.fromShortcut(char), Suit.fromShortcut(char)

      • resetDeck

        public static void resetDeck()
        Clears all cards that have been previously dealt by calling randomCard() and makes them available again.

      • getSuit

        public Suit getSuit()
        The suit of this card
        Returns:
        suit of this card

      • getRank

        public Rank getRank()
        The rank of this card
        Returns:
        rank of this card

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a human-readable name of this card.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A human-readable String like "Ace of Clubs" or "Tray of Diamonds"

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
        Whether this Card equals the supplied Object. Cards are deemed equal if they match in both suit and rank.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
